TopicTitle: SLS might get a new name and take funding from Earth science programs

Articles.Content:

New name for Space Launch System gets backing of lawmakers

> 
> A push to give NASAÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Space Launch System a new name is garnering support from lawmakers, who have written into legislation provisions that would order NASA to rename the heavy-lift rocket through a competition among schoolchildren.
> 
> If passed into law, the bill would set policy for NASA and includes budget guidelines that would shuffle funding from the agencyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Earth science programs into other areas, primarily the Space Launch System, Orion crew capsule and robotic exploration of the solar system.

So I get that the name is uninspiring, but so was the STS. The worst thing is that it's going to take funding from Earth science programs.

It's quite obvious why they are taking away funding from the Earth science programs, that means the SLS needs to be named accordingly.

I'm opting for CO2.
